content:
I’m an experienced product leader that specializes in media technology, strategic planning, and content positioning.
Previously, I spent a decade at NPR working as a Product Manager for the Public Radio Satellite System (PRSS). I was also a producer and director in NPR’s Programming department.
You can find my published works at the link below. Published Work
title: Alex Curley

content: Here’s a selection of notable things I’ve published or worked on over the past few years:
title: Published Works

summary: Timberborn and Manor Lords got a quick review from me for NPR Gaming’s mid-2024 showcase.
title: The best games of 2024 so far, picked by NPR's staff | NPR.org

summary: I previewed five big upcoming games - Life by You, Homeworld 3, Manor Lords, Frostpunk 2, and Stormgate - in this annual round-up.
title: NPR’s 24 most anticipated video games of 2024 | NPR.org

summary: My thoughts on Age of Wonders 4, Terra Nil, Diablo 4, and Company of Heroes 3, made our round-up of the top video games of 2023.
title: The best games of 2023, picked by the NPR staff | NPR.org

summary: Two big strategy games debuted in the same week: Total War: Pharaoh, and Star Trek: Infinite. I took a deep dive into both in this standalone article.
title: ‘Total War: Pharaoh’ and ‘Star Trek: Infinite’: boldly going where we’ve been before | NPR.org

summary: I reviewed Homeseek, the Frostpunk-esque city-builder, in NPR’s Fall 2023 round-up.
title: Detective Pikachu Returns, Assassin’s Creed Mirage and more Fall games reviewed | NPR.org

summary: Activision Blizzard’s blockbuster Diablo IV landed in May 2023 after much anticipation (and an impressive marketing blitz). I got to give the game a full treatment, including some custom gameplay GIFs.
title: 'Diablo IV' Review: Activision Blizzard deals old-school devilish delights | NPR.org

summary: I contributed some voice work for this episode on NPR’s (now former) hip-hop podcast Louder Than A Riot.
title: What doesn't kill you makes you a strong Black woman: Rico Nasty | Louder Than A Riot

summary: Triumph’s Age of Wonders 4 topped my list of top strategy games in an otherwise disappointing year for the genre. I recounted my triumphs and tribulations in this full review on NPR.org.
title: 'Age of Wonders 4' Review: This Magical Mystery Game is Hoping to Take You Away | NPR.org

summary: In March of 2023, I gave glowing reviews to Terra Nil, the post-apocalyptic city-builder, and the Diablo IV beta.
title: NPR staff review the biggest games of March, and more | NPR.org

summary: Ocassionally I will don an old-timey newscaster voice for Throughline, NPR’s excellent history podcast. I’ve made at least 8 appearances since the podcast began.
title: Everyone Everywhere All At Once | Throughline

summary: Pharoah, the 1999 city-building classing, was resurrected in February of 2023. I wrote a short review for that Spring’s gaming round-up.
title: NPR staff review the best new games and some you may have missed | NPR.org

summary: I was complimentary of, but not blown away by, Company of Heroes 3 in my first standalone gaming review for NPR. Also my first official by-line on the website.
title: 'Company of Heroes 3' deserves a spot in any war game fan's library | NPR.org

summary: I produced and launched this news-responsive podcast, State of Ukraine, shortly after Russia began its invasion. This is the inaugural episode.
title: The latest on the attacks in Ukraine | State of Ukraine

summary: I provided technical and production support for children’s podcast Wow in the World from their inception in 2017 until they left the NPR network in 2020. This is my last credited appearance.
title: Chugga Chugga CHEW CHEW! The Science of Misophonia | Wow in the World

summary: I tried baked cricket snacks in front of a microphonr for Hidden Brain in 2018. They weren’t bad! I also provided the show with some voicework in 2019.
title: Crickets And Cannibals: Unpacking The Complicated Emotion Of Disgust | Hidden Brain
